result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
Defendant to be SUPERVISED BY THE MENTAL HEALTH UNIT OF D.O.C.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA & DV surcharges due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
No violent contact with victim, will be restricted if defendant is not in compliance with mental health treatment and medication.

Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
Defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review (as to probation only).
****May 9, 2014/Judge Grady... ORDER FOR COMMITMENT FOR NON-COMPLIANCE OF PROBATION CONDITIONS- Court orders 30 days straight time forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
(x) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  02-05-2015       Initials:  sm
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court held colloquy with agent and defendant regarding status of probation progress. Case adjourned for probation review hearing to allow for further investigation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $51 witness fees for witness Angela R. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26198805 in court 3x on 1/15/14, 3/13/14, 4/3/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 5/29/14 for Angela R. for 3 appearances on 1/15/14, 3/13/14, 4/3/14.

Signed & Filed, Order for Commitment for Condition Time For Non-compliance with Probation Conditions--Domestic Violence Court. FILE NOT IN COURT. DOC Agent contacted the court to request condition time due to probation condition violation. Defendant to serve 30 DAYS of the condition time; straight time; forthwith. Case remains set for Probation Review Hearing on 8/01/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Invoice dated: 03-31-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on  in the amount of $750.00 to Dr. Lundbohm for services on 02/27, 03/05/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Victim addressed the court.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS & 6 MONTHS,  credit for 91 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review (as to probation only).
-Court requested defendant be SUPERVISED BY THE MENTAL HEALTH UNIT OF D.O.C.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim, will be restricted if defendant is not in compliance with mental health treatment and medication.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA & DV surcharges due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case passed from 8:30 am session.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court VACATED Jury Trial.
Cas passed to allow ADA to reach victim.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Court reviewed report, defendant was found competent to proceed. Parties do not contest the findings. Defense counsel requests a plea & sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 23  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

received from Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D., Licensed Psychologist, dated March 5, 2014 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered  the defendant be examined for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 23.  Filed, signed Order for Examination.

Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in custody.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Erik Rodriguez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Branch 23, Judge Grady hearing a jury trial for Branch 04, Judge Flanagan. Branch 40, Judge Dallet agreed to hear this case for Branch 23. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Angela R.; Jose GC and Elizabeth DR

Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Francisco J Santana-Santana in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
